analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, the triplets, the text on the law of conditionality in brief

original: Āsavavippayuttaṁ naanāsavaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā āsavavippayutto anāsavo kusalo🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Āsavavippayuttaṁ naanāsavaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā🔽āsavavippayutto sāsavo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā
analyzed: āsava vippayuttam na anāsavam na kusalam dhammam paccayā āsava vippayuttaḥ anāsavaḥ kusalo  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā āsava vippayuttam na anāsavam na kusalam dhammam paccayā  āsava vippayuttaḥ sa āsavaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā
translated: The uncontaminated wholesome conditioned phenomena that are not associated with the pollutants are a condition, as a condition by way of root cause, for a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is uncontaminated and not associated with the pollutants.

original: dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Āsavavippayuttaṁ naanāsavaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā āsavavippayutto sāsavo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: dve pe a vigate dve  āsava vippayuttam na anāsavam na akusalam dhammam paccayā āsava vippayuttaḥ sa āsavaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: The uncontaminated wholesome conditioned phenomena that are not associated with the pollutants are a condition, as a condition by way of root cause, for a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is uncontaminated and associated with the pollutants. (In brief.) As root cause condition, two … as object condition, two … as non-ensuing condition, two.🔽The unwholesome conditioned phenomena that are not associated with the pollutants and are not uncontaminated are a condition, as a condition by way of root cause, for a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is associated with the pollutants and is unwholesome. (In brief.) As root cause condition, one … as object condition, one … as non-ensuing condition, one.

original: Āsavavippayuttaṁ nasāsavaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavavippayutto sāsavo abyākato
analyzed: āsava vippayuttam na sa āsavam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca āsava vippayuttaḥ sa āsavaḥ abyākataḥ
translated: The uncontaminated unwholesome conditioned phenomena that are not associated with the pollutants are a condition, as a condition by way of object, for a wholesome unwholesome conditioned phenomenon that is uncontaminated and associated with the pollutants.

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Āsavavippayuttaṁ naanāsavaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽āsavavippayutto sāsavo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā āsava vippayuttam na anāsavam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca  āsava vippayuttaḥ sa āsavaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā
translated: A non-causally-originated, not-subject-to-cancelling, indeterminate, state is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a causally-originated, subject-to-cancelling, indeterminate, state. A causally-originated, subject-to-cancelling, indeterminate, state is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a non-causally-originated, not-subject-to-cancelling, indeterminate, state. A causally-originated, subject-to-cancelling, indeterminate, state is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a causally-originated, subject-to-cancelling, indeterminate, state. A non-causally-originated, not-subject-to-cancelling, indeterminate, state is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a non-causally-originated, not-subject-to-cancelling, indeterminate, state. (In brief.)

analyzed: dve adhipatiyā dve pe a vigate dve
translated: As to cause there are two, as to predominance two … as to non-hindrance two.
